title: HR SM use case: Request for remote country work
content:
Pete, an employee, wants to temporarily work remotely from a foreign country after spending some of his annual leave there. To do this, he must first request and obtain approval from his line manager and org owner. 

This use case demonstrates how Service Management can automate the handling of formal approvals and process tasks related to an HR request.

The following personas are involved in this use case.

Persona Responsibilities
Pete - Employee Makes the request for remote country work and confirms his return.

Paul - Manager

 Approves the request for remote country work

Lynn - Org owner

 Approves the request for remote country work

Eve - HR agent

 Closes the ticket when Pete confirms his return.

Prerequisites

You must have deployed the HR Content package. The package contains the Request Remote Country Work Agreement service offering that is required to fulfill Pete's request.

For more information about how to deploy content packages for Service Management, see Content.

(Optional) Configure the offering

No further configuration of the Request Remote Country Work Agreement service offering is required to run the use case as described here.

If you want to modify the offering to meet your specific needs, log in to the Agent Portal as the tenant admin, navigate to Plan > Service Catalog > Travel and Time Off > Travel, and then select the Request Remote Country Work Agreement service offering.

Use case 

Step 1: Employee accesses the Service Portal and submits a Request

Persona
Pete - Employee

Pete logs in to the Service Portal, where he knows he can have access to a variety of self service support features, such as catalog, knowledge, and subscription management for the applications he uses every day.

Pete selects the Travel and Time Off catalog, and then requests the Request Remote Country Work Agreement service offering.

He enters the required information, including:

  • The business justification for the remote work request
  • His date of departure
  • His immigration status in his country of employment
  • The start date for the remote work
  • His immigration status in the country where he wants to work remotely
  • His country of employment
  • The country where he wants to work remotely
  • His return date
  • The end date for the remote work

When he has entered all the information, Pete clicks Submit, and a request is created.

Step 2: Manager approval

Persona

Paul - Manager

Paul receives an email notification from Service Management that Pete's request is pending his approval. He clicks the link in the email and is taken to his approval queue. After reviewing the request, Paul clicks Approve.

Step 3: Org owner approval

Persona

Lynn - Org owner

Lynn is already logged in to Service Portal, and she notices that she has 3 to-do items, one of which is to approve Pete's request. Lynn clicks Approve.

Step 4: Employee works remotely

Persona
Pete - Employee

Pete receives now receives a sequence of emails:

  • Confirmation of his request's approval
  • Notification of his request's assignment to Eve
  • Instructions to add a comment to the request on his return.

On the date of his return to his country of employment, Pete clicks the link in the email, and adds a comment to confirm his return.

Step 5: Completion

Persona

Eve - HR agent

Eve sees Pete's comment confirming his return and closes the request.
